intro: Paepalanthus scleranthus, commonly known as the hardstem buttercup, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and wet meadows. Its leaves are simple and alternate, with a rough texture, and it produces small, aggregate fruits. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
